item.description: Popular Sunshine Coast brewery and music venue Terella Brewing will close after a legal stoush with the local council.

item.description: The mother of a teenage girl who took her own life a few hours after being released from a Perth mental health ward says a series of systemic failures is responsible for her daughter's death.

item.description: The bones of a Queensland lighthouse keeper's wife were almost lost as a result of rising sea levels nearly 150 years after her death.

item.description: Landholders opposed to VNI West have been given 30 days to allow environmental assessments before authorised officers can enter by force.

item.title: Australian Antarctic team yields big haul of fresh produce with hydroponics
item.description: Antarctica is the coldest, driest and windiest continent on the planet. But at Casey Station, Australian expeditioners have grown 130 kilos of fresh produce in a year thanks to a hydroponics facility.

item.description: The Launceston City Council has revealed the redevelopment of a historic theatre and arts centre will cost almost 50 per cent more than expected, but the mayor insists it is "not a cost blowout".

item.description: Ngaiawang language, once spoken frequently along the sweeping bend of the River Murray or the Rinta, was almost wiped out by colonisation.

item.description: When Scott Dixon-Smith started his career, his workplace accommodated his blindness but not his sexuality. Tonight, he will march in the pride parade with the help of his guide dog, Pretzel.

item.description: Denmark is fast-tracking female conscription as it muscles up to Russia and faces threats of invasion from the US.

item.description: NASA shakes up its Artemis Moon exploration program, adding an extra practice flight before a crewed lunar landing planned for two years' time.

item.description: After experiencing tremendous success in Las Vegas, Peter V'landys is planning to take the NRL to other major cities around the world.

item.description: MaryAnn Bin-Sallik was the first Aboriginal nurse graduate in Darwin and the first Aboriginal person to receive a PhD at Harvard University. Following her death at age 85, the Djaru Elder is being remembered for her work in Indigenous education, health and human rights.

item.description: The charging of two young West Australian men with terror offences show the challenges facing social cohesion, and solving the problem is not going to be easy.

item.title: Indepedent review of Inpex Ichthys LNG project finds emissions were 'systematically underestimated' for years
item.description: An independent review into oil and gas company Inpex has found widespread and persistent failures in how emissions were calculated, recorded and reported, dating back to the start of production in 2018.

item.title: Celebrations mixed with grief as Iranian Australians react to US-Israeli airstrikes
item.description: Iranian Australians attend large gatherings around the country to mark the death of Iran's supreme leader in air strikes by the United States and Israel.

item.title: Iranian strikes damage Dubai international airport and Burj Al Arab luxury hotel
item.description: Iran's retaliatory strikes have damaged Dubai's international airport and the landmark sail-shaped Burj Al Arab hotel.

item.title: Piper James farewelled by family and friends after her death on Queensland's K'gari
item.description: The 19-year-old is remembered at a funeral on Vancouver Island as her parents call for an inquest into her death on Queensland's K'gari.

item.title: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's death may not lead to regime change in Iran
item.description: The death of Iran's supreme leader leaves a power vacuum in a perilously unstable country. It could end with a military takeover and a new leader with a no-limits approach to war.

item.title: Labor promises to wipe public school fees from 2027 while Liberals set target for zero litter in oceans within a decade
item.description: Labor has vowed to abolish public school fees for primary and high school students from 2027, if it's returned to Government, while the Liberal Party said it will commit $4.3 million to stop stormwater litter reaching South Australia's coastline.

item.title: Queensland talent scouts use 'world-first' AI to broaden search for 2032 Olympians
item.description: A sliding doors moment can be all it takes to put someone on the path to elite sport. But those in charge of finding our next Olympians have a "world-first" idea to change that.

item.title: Sam Kerr fires Australia to victory over the Philippines in Asian Cup opener
item.description: The Matildas get off to a winning start, but the Filipinas don't make things easy in the opening game of the 2026 Women's Asian Cup at Perth Stadium.

item.title: Terror accused Jayson Joseph Michaels revealed as former Christian schoolboy and labourer
item.description: Jayson Joseph Michaels, 20, left school to undertake a TAFE course in IT and worked as a labourer in Bindoon, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Australia's Hannah Green wins Women's World Championship in Singapore
item.description: Hannah Green triumphs at the Women's World Championship for a second time, holding off fast-finishing American Auston Kim in Singapore.

item.title: Townsville Fire defeat Perth Lynx 108-105 to claim WNBL Championship
item.description: Townsville Fire claim their second WNBL title in four years, defeating Perth Lynx 108-105 in overtime to wrap up the grand final series in the second game.

item.title: Travellers sleep at airport amid warning of 'significant disruptions' from Middle East conflict
item.description: Australia's airports peak body has warned of "significant disruptions" to global aviation in coming days after the Middle East erupted into conflict and flights to the region were cancelled.

item.title: Demons AFL premiership defender Steven May retires ahead of 2026 season
item.description: Steven May, a key figure in the Demons' 2021 premiership win, announces his retirement just days out from the start of the AFL season.

item.title: Alyssa Healy scores century as Australia thrashes India by 185 runs in final ODI
item.description: Alyssa Healy puts an exclamation mark on her ODI career, as Australia records a 185-run win over India in Hobart.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: How the internet reacted to Matildas 1-0 win over Philippines
item.description: The Matildas opened their Women's Asian Cup 2026 campaign with a win, beating the Philippines 1-0 in Perth, and the internet watched on with bated breath.

item.title: Explosions rock Tehran as clerical regime vows to avenge Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
item.description: Outrage over the attack targeting Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei spilled over into neighbouring Iraq and Pakistan, where crowds attempted to storm American diplomatic missions.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Volunteer-run Punjabi school creating community for parents and students in Geelong
item.description: When the Virasati Punjabi School Geelong started five years ago, it had 15 students. Now, it has 53.

item.title: Live: Trump says fighting could last 'four weeks or so'
item.description: Fresh explosions rock Tehran as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vows to intensify air strikes. Follow live.

item.title: This week in history quiz, March 2: Can you pass the test?
item.description: Where was MH370 heading, which Australian won our first Oscar and what was the world's first vampire movie?

item.title: The four stages of the mental load explained
item.description: While research has found mothers do more in all four stages of cognitive labour, there was one stage where men were more active than others.

item.title: Meet the Australians making the ultimate tree change
item.description: Moving to the country might sound idyllic to overstimulated and stressed-out city dwellers, but for Max and Courtney, it took some soul-searching to find their purpose and a place to really call home.

item.title: Tasmanian government spent more than $105 million last year to employ temporary nurses
item.description: State government spending on locum nurses continues to rapidly rise, despite repeated calls to build a more permanent workforce.

item.title: PM's swift support for US-Israel strikes in Iran shows how times have changed
item.description: The speed at which the Albanese government backed the US-Israel operation is a tale of a changed world and a radically altered domestic environment.

item.title: Melbourne woman fears for her mother in Iranian prison amid US-Israeli strikes on Iran
item.description: As the US-Israel strikes ramp up, a Melbourne woman fears the Islamic Republic could execute her mother for a "false accusation" of "spying" on Israel.

item.title: How Marjorie Taylor Greene crossed Donald Trump to help unleash the Epstein files
item.description: Many of Donald Trump's supporters wanted to send those implicated in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking ring "off to the gallows", but then the president changed his mind about releasing the files. What followed was an unusual political manoeuvre, acts of immense bravery by survivors and a backflip by the president of the United States.

item.title: American service members killed as Iran strikes back against US-Israel attack
item.description: As the US military confirms several deaths and injuries among its ranks, Donald Trump says the attack on Iran could be a "four-week process".

item.title: Interest rate hikes failing to dampen property prices in mid-size and regional areas
item.description: Nationally, the median house price for all the capital cities is now more than $1 million.

item.title: How one change to Disability Discrimination Act could make it less 'daunting'
item.description: Australia's Disability Discrimination Act is decades old, with reform "well overdue". Removing the burden of proof could be the first step.

item.title: Going once, going twice, sold! What's on offer this election from Labor and Liberal to fix the housing crisis
item.description: South Australia's housing market is running hot. When it comes to securing votes, the major parties want those caught up in the crisis to buy what they're selling.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Kerr makes difference, Fowler's class cameo and Lincoln cool in a crisis
item.description: Sam Kerr makes the difference, Mary Fowler has a class cameo and Chloe Lincoln is cool in an injury crisis. Here are the quick hits from the Matildas' Asian Cup opener against the Philippines.

item.title: What life looks like for Ukrainians who fled and can never return
item.description: As Russian forces took control of their cities, millions of Ukrainians fled. Many still live as refugees, fearing they may never see their families or home towns again.

item.title: When the Formula 1 Australian Grand Prix is on, how to watch, all F1 teams and drivers
item.description: New cars, new drivers and one entirely new team descend on Melbourne as Formula 1 returns for the 2026 season.

item.title: Bondi neighbourhood split over illegal chopping of tree in broad daylight
item.description: Residents of a quiet street in Bondi are split after men wearing high-vis and wielding chainsaws allegedly illegally destroyed a tree.

item.title: Diesel sales surge on home deliveries, while E10 and LPG sales plunge
item.description: New figures show Australian diesel sales are rising as customers buy more products online, while E10 and LPG sales continue to fall.

item.title: If Trump wants regime change, it will likely take more than killing Khamenei
item.description: Cracks are appearing in Iran's regime, but sparking the change Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu want to see will likely take more than killing the Ayatollah.

item.title: Matt Jacobs has a tick-induced red-meat allergy. Four doctors didn't know what it was
item.description: Australia's first death from a tick-induced allergy has sparked calls to ramp up awareness among the public and the medical profession.

item.title: Plea for government to help vulnerable kids as in-home childcare services face collapse
item.description: In-home care provides services to about 1,000 families, but its viability is under threat because it is excluded from a government payment covering rising worker costs.

item.title: As the price of intelligence collapses, agentic AI is replacing human workers
item.description: An entire retail and wholesale ecosystem has sprung from nothing in about a year, in a way that most people don't yet understand.

item.title: Playing before eating helps Central Coast public school students perform better in the classroom
item.description: Playing before eating has led to higher academic performance and fewer behavioural issues among students at a NSW public school.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: 'Messy' Matildas happy with win but promise more next time
item.description: The Matildas' 1-0 win over the Philippines in Perth wasn't their best performance. But they've promised better things are on the horizon — and there's reason to believe them.

item.title: India defeats West Indies, South Africa beats Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup Super Eights
item.description: India has reached the semifinals of the T20 World Cup with a five-wicket win over West Indies in Sunday's decisive Super Eights match.

item.title: Privacy fears as OpenAI trials ads in its ChatGPT chatbot in the US
item.description: The company said advertisements will appear at the bottom of answers and will be based on a user's current conversation.

item.title: Toowoomba mother and son hide as thieves target home for third time
item.description: Intruders break into a Toowoomba family's home in a post-midnight raid, forcing the woman and her 11-year-old son to lock themselves in a room after calling Triple Zero.

item.title: Queensland on cyclone watch as rain drenches parts of state
item.description: Parts of Queensland have been drenched by more than 200 millimetres of rain in less than 24 hours — and there is more rain and potentially a cyclone on the way.

item.title: Live: Iran strikes set to rattle markets, oil and gold prices jump
item.description: Global markets are braced for the fallout from the outbreak of war in the Middle East. Follow today's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Live: Government estimates 115,000 Australians in Middle East amid conflict
item.description: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the government wants to wait and see if commercial flights to transport hubs in the Middle East restart before it considers repatriation flights for the 115,000 Australians estimated to be in the region. Follow live.

item.title: Australians stranded due to airspace closures after US-Israel strikes on Iran
item.description: Australians are left stranded overseas amid ongoing hostilities in the Middle East, with one woman saying she was forced to sleep on an airport floor.

item.title: Terminally ill Mildura grandmother blasts regional airlines at Productivity Commission hearing
item.description: The Australian government asked this woman how she felt about regional airfares. She didn't hold back.

item.title: Flash flooding hits Mildura after 100mm of rain in 24 hours
item.description: Heavy rainfall causes flash flooding in Mildura as the city records its wettest March day.

item.title: The Nightcliff by-election is this weekend. Here is why it's happening and how to vote
item.description: Residents living in Darwin's northern suburbs of Nightcliff, Rapid Creek and parts of Coconut Grove will be heading to the polls this Saturday to vote in a by-election. It comes after the former member for Nightcliff resigned in February.

item.title: WA transport bodies call for tougher truck licensing model
item.description: Western Australia's transport industry is calling on the WA government to follow South Australia's lead in reforming its heavy vehicle licensing system, amid a "surge" in the number of road trains crossing the Nullarbor this week.
